A lazy admin reused primes in his RSA keys. Can you decrypt the secret message? Ciphertext: 5067954704071674565299095281373654115430925037701060023434418891859840439161598985790117505215763259126982081162709495596235712267311029925793663829193811

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5479187563636561074248592725823771906679104228848398653688651260176987262415562060362253997510447184236479279856225166479984598992224596603942026592921441, e=916181786951296021184496750953223520811689441051741094102537166954210096271982324432440735780569113327802564398285819050012216005137046253844115335153239

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{s462ivn4}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5067954704071674565299095281373654115430925037701060023434418891859840439161598985790117505215763259126982081162709495596235712267311029925793663829193811
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5479187563636561074248592725823771906679104228848398653688651260176987262415562060362253997510447184236479279856225166479984598992224596603942026592921441, e=916181786951296021184496750953223520811689441051741094102537166954210096271982324432440735780569113327802564398285819050012216005137046253844115335153239
